standard_metadata.standard_description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values; use positive and negative numbers to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation.

question.content: Lerma, Mexico is located $2{,}570\text{ m}$ above sea level.  **Which number represents the elevation of Lerma, Mexico in meters?**

hints.content: "Sea level" refers to an elevation of $0$ meters. "Above sea level" refers to elevations *greater than* $\blueE0$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line is labeled negative 3,000 to 3,000 from bottom to top in increments of 500. A thick tick mark at 0 is labeled "sea level". The number line below 0 is labeled "below". The number line above 0 is labeled "above".

hints.content: Since $\maroonD{\text{Lerma, Mexico}}$ is located $2{,}570\text{ m}$ *above* sea level, its elevation is *greater than* $\blueE{0}$ and *positive*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line is labeled negative 3,000 to 3,000 from bottom to top in increments of 500. The number line is labeled "sea level" at 0. A point at 2,570 is labeled "Lerma, Mexico".

hints.content: The elevation of $\maroonD{\text{Lerma, Mexico}}$ is $2{,}570$ meters.

question.content: Lake Moeris in Egypt is located $43\text{ m}$ below sea level.  **Which number represents the elevation of Lake Moeris in meters?**

hints.content: "Sea level" refers to an elevation of $0$ meters. "Below sea level" refers to elevations *less than* $\blueE0$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 100 to 100 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 20. All spaces below 0 are labeled Below, 0 is labeled Sea level, and all spaces above 0 are labeled Above.

hints.content: Since $\tealE{\text{Lake Moeris}}$ is located $43\text{ m}$ *below* sea level, its elevation is *less than* $\blueE{0}$ and *negative*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 100 to 100 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 20. 0 is labeled Sea level and Lake Moeris is labeled just below negative 40.

hints.content: The elevation of $\tealE{\text{Lake Moeris}}$ is $-43$ meters.

question.content: Kingston, Jamaica is located in the Caribbean islands. In December, its average temperature is $27\degree\text{C}$ above zero.  **Which number represents the average temperature (in $\degree\text{C}$) of Kingston, Jamaica in December?**

hints.content: "Above zero" refers to temperatures *greater than $\blueE0$ degrees*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 40 to 40 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 10. All spaces below 0 are labeled Below zero, 0 is labeled Zero, and all spaces above 0 are labeled Above zero.

hints.content: Since the average temperature of $\maroonD{\text{Kingston, Jamaica}}$ in December is $27\degree\text{C}$ *above* zero, it is *greater than* $\blueE{0}$ and *positive*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 40 to 40 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 10. 0 is labeled Zero and Kingston, Jamaica is labeled just below 30.

hints.content: The average temperature of $\maroonD{\text{Kingston, Jamaica}}$ in December is $27\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: Harbin, China is known as the "Ice City." In December, its average temperature is $15\degree\text{C}$ below zero.  **Which number represents the average temperature (in $\degree\text{C}$) of Harbin, China in December?**

hints.content: "Below zero" refers to temperatures *less than $\blueE0$ degrees*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line is labeled negative 40 to 40 from bottom to top in increments of 10. A thick tick mark at 0 is labeled "Zero". The number line below 0 is labeled "below zero". The number line above 0 is labeled "above zero".

hints.content: Since the average temperature of $\tealE{\text{Harbin, China}}$ in December is $15\degree\text{C}$ *below* zero, it is *less than* $\blueE{0}$ and *negative*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line is labeled negative 40 to 40 from bottom to top in increments of 10. A thick tick mark at 0 is labeled "Zero". A point is drawn at  negative 15 and is labeled "Harbin, China".

hints.content: The average temperature of $\tealE{\text{Harbin, China}}$ in December is $-15\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: Yellowknife, Canada was named the "Coldest Canada city" in 2014. In January, its average temperature is $26\degree\text{C}$ below zero.  **Which number represents the average temperature (in $\degree\text{C}$) of Yellowknife, Canada in January?**

hints.content: "Below zero" refers to temperatures *less than $\blueE0$ degrees*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line is labeled negative 40 to 40 from bottom to top in increments of 10. A thick tick mark at 0 is labeled "Zero". The number line below 0 is labeled "below zero". The number line above 0 is labeled "above zero".

hints.content: Since the average temperature of $\tealE{\text{Yellowknife, Canada}}$ in January is $26\degree\text{C}$ *below* zero, it is *less than* $\blueE{0}$ and *negative*.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 40 to 40 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 10. 0 is labeled Zero and Yellowknife, Canada is labeled just above negative 30.

hints.content: The average temperature of $\tealE{\text{Yellowknife, Canada}}$ in January is $-26\degree\text{C}$.

question.content: A bank uses positive numbers to represent deposits and negative numbers to represent withdrawals.   **Which number represents a deposit of $126$ dollars?**

options.content: $126$ dollars
$-126$ dollars

hints.content: A *deposit* represents a *positive* amount of money.
*Positive* amounts of money are *greater* than zero.
The deposit would be represented as $126$ dollars.

question.content: Kai goes out to lunch with their friends. At the end of the meal, they receive a bill for $51$ euros.  **Which number represents the change in the amount of money Kai and their friends have?**

options.content: $51$ euros
$-51$ euros

hints.content: Kai and their friends *owe* the restaurant money. When you *owe* someone, that leads to a *negative* change in your amount of money.
*Negative* amounts of money are *less* than zero.
Kai and their friends will have a change of $-51$ euros.

question.content: After returning a few items from online shopping, Luca received a credit of $125$ dollars in his bank account.   **What does the number $125$ mean?**

options.content: Luca received $125$ dollars in his account.
Luca owes $125$ dollars to the bank.

hints.content: Luca's bill shows he has a credit $\tealE{125}$ dollars in his account. *Positive* amounts are *greater than zero*.
A credit means the store gave that amount of money back to Luca's account. In other words, Luca *got* the money.
Luca received $125$ dollars in his account.

question.content: Claire makes a list of her income and expenses. Her list is shown below.  Income/Expense | Amount - | -  Cell phone bill | $-45$ euros  Paycheck | $+100$ euros  Utilities | $-55$ euros  Babysitting | $+20$ euros  Groceries | $-30$ euros   **What does the number $-45$ mean?**

options.content: Claire has $45$ euros in her account.
Claire has to pay $45$ euros to the cellphone company.

hints.content: Claire's wrote down $\tealE{-}45$ euros for her cellphone bill. *Negative* amounts are *less than zero*.
A negative amount means Claire needs to *pay* the cellphone company. In other words, Claire *owes* the cellphone company money.
Claire has to pay $45$ euros to the cellphone company.

question.content: Denver, Colorado is called the "Mile High City". The elevation is $1{,}609\text{ m}$.  **What does the number $1{,}609$ mean?**

options.content: Denver, Colorado is located $1{,}609\text{ m}$ above sea level.
Denver, Colorado is located $1{,}609\text{ m}$ below sea level.

hints.content: The elevation of Denver, Colorado is $\tealE{1{,}609}$ meters. *Positive* elevations are *greater than zero*.
A positive elevation means the location is *above sea level*.
Denver, Colorado is located $1{,}609\text{ m}$ above sea level.

question.content: The elevation of Death Valley, CA is $-86\text{ m}$.  **What does the number $-86$ mean?**

options.content: Death Valley is located $86\text{ m}$ above sea level.
Death Valley is located $86\text{ m}$ below sea level.

hints.content: The elevation of Death Valley is $\tealE{-}86$ meters. *Negative* elevations are *less than zero*.
A negative elevation means the location is *below sea level*.
Death Valley is located $86\text{ m}$ below sea level.

question.content: Last month, Seth made a profit of $\$401$ from selling stocks.  **What does the number $401$ mean?**

options.content: Seth gained $\$401$ from selling stocks.
Seth lost $\$401$ from selling stocks.

hints.content: Seth made a profit of $\$401$ from selling stocks. *Positive* amounts are *greater than zero*.
A *positive profit* means Seth *gained money* from selling stocks.
Seth gained $\$401$ from selling stocks.

question.content: Dubai, United Arab Emirates set a record temperature for $49\degree\text{C}$.  **What does the number $49$ mean?**

options.content: Dubai's record high temperature is $49\degree\text{C}$ above zero.
Dubai's record high temperature is $49\degree\text{C}$ below zero.

hints.content: Dubai, United Arab Emirates has a temperature of $49\degree\text{C}$. *Positive* amounts are *higher than zero*.
A *positive temperature* means the temperature is *greater* than zero
Dubai's record high temperature is $49\degree\text{C}$ above zero.

question.content: Dudinka, Russia is located above the Arctic circle. During the winter months, the daily minimum temperature is $-33\degree\text{C}$.  **What does the number $-33$ mean?**

options.content: Dudinka minimum temperature is $33\degree\text{C}$ above zero.
Dudinka minimum temperature is $33\degree\text{C}$ below zero.

hints.content: Dudinka, Russia has a daily minimum temperature of $-33\degree\text{C}$. *Positive* amounts are *higher than zero*.
A *negative temperature* means the temperature is *less* than zero
Dudinka minimum temperature is $33\degree\text{C}$ below zero.

question.content: Geographers use negative numbers to represent points below sea level and positive numbers to represent points above sea level. For example, the lowest point in New Orleans is at $-2$ meters, and the highest point is at $6$ meters.  **What does $0$ meters represent?**

options.content: The lowest point in New Orleans
Sea level
The highest point in New Orleans

hints.content: Let's visualize the points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  What does each point represent in this context?

images.alt: A vertical number line goes from negative 4 to 8 from bottom to top and is labeled in increments of 2. A point at 6 is labeled "highest point". A point at 0 is labeled "question mark." A point at negative 2 is labeled "lowest point".

hints.content: Each positive or negative value gives a distance relative to sea level. The value $\blueE{0}$ is no distance from sea level, so it must represent sea level.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line goes from negative 4 to 8 from bottom to top and is labeled in increments of 2.  A point at 0 is labeled "sea level". A point at negative 2 is labeled "2 meters below sea level". A point at 6 is labeled "6 meters above sea level".

hints.content: $\blueE{0}$ represents sea level.

question.content: Jonas is planning out his route for an upcoming race. He uses negative numbers to represent points before the finish line and positive numbers to represent points after the finish line.  On Jonas's map, there is a bridge at $-91$ meters, and a restaurant is at $14$ meters.  **What does $0$ meters represent?**

options.content: The bridge
The finish line
The restaurant

hints.content: Let's visualize the points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  What does each point represent in this context?

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 100 to 100 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 10. A solid point labeled Bridge is plotted just below negative 90. A solid point labeled question mark is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled Restaurant is plotted just above 10.

hints.content: Each positive or negative value gives a distance relative to the finish line. The value $\blueE{0}$ is no distance from the finish line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 100 to 100 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 10. A solid point labeled 91 meters before the finish line is plotted just below negative 90. A solid point labeled Finish line is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled 14 meters after finish line is plotted just above 10.

hints.content: $\blueE{0}$ represents the finish line.

question.content: Gabe is mapping out important family events. He uses negative numbers to represent time before he was born and positive numbers to represent time after he was born. For example, Gabe's mom was given a special coin in year $-20$, and Gabe's sister was born in year $7$.   **What does year $0$ represent?**

options.content: The year Gabe's mom was given a special coin
The year Gabe was born
The year Gabe's sister was born

hints.content: Let's visualize the points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  What does each point represent in this context?

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 20 to 10 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 5. A solid point labeled Sister born is plotted between 5 and 10. A solid point labeled question mark is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled Special coin is plotted at negative 20.

hints.content: Each positive or negative value gives a time relative to when Gabe was born. The value $\blueE{0}$ is no years from when Gabe was born.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 20 to 10 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 5. A solid point labeled 7 years after Gabe is born is plotted between 5 and 10. A solid point labeled Gabe is born is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled 20 years before Gabe is born is plotted at negative 20.

hints.content: $\blueE{0}$ represents the year Gabe was born.

question.content: In a board game, negative number cards represent moving backward and positive number cards represent moving forward. For example, Nuha drew a card with $4$ and moved forward $4$ spaces.  Raha draws a card with $0$.    **What does $0$ represent in the board game?**

options.content: Losing all points
Going back to the starting space
Not moving any spaces

hints.content: Let's visualize the points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  What does each point represent in this context?

images.alt: A number line from negative 5 to 5 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. A solid point labeled question mark is plotted at 0. All spaces left of 0 are labeled Moving backward and all spaces right of 0 are labeled Moving forward.

hints.content: $\goldE{0}$ separates moving $\maroonD{\text{backward}}$ and moving $\tealE{\text{forward}}$, so $\goldE{0}$ must represent not moving at all.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line from negative 5 to 5 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. A solid point labeled Not moving is plotted at 0. All spaces left of 0 are labeled Moving backward and all spaces right of 0 are labeled Moving forward.

hints.content: $\goldE{0}$ represents not moving any spaces.

question.content: A chameleon is looking for prey. Let positive numbers represent the elevation of prey above the chameleon and negative numbers represent the elevation of prey below the chameleon.  The chameleon spots a fly at $4 \text{ m}$ and a grasshopper at $-6\text{ m}$.  **What does an elevation of $0 \text{ m}$ represent in this situation?**

options.content: The elevation of the fly
The elevation of the chameleon
The elevation of the grasshopper

hints.content: Let's visualize the points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  What does each point represent in this context?

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 10 to 10 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. A solid point labeled Grasshopper is plotted at negative 6. A solid point labeled question mark is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled Fly is plotted at 4.

hints.content: $0\text{ m}$ separates $\maroonE{\text{above}}$ and $\tealE{\text{below}}$ a certain elevation. The elevations of the fly and the grasshopper are both stated in relation to the elevation of the chameleon.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 10 to 10 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. A solid point labeled Below chameleon is plotted at negative 6. A solid point labeled Chameleon elevation is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled Above chameleon is plotted at 4.

hints.content: $0\text{ m}$ represents the elevation of the chameleon.

question.content: Credit card companies use negative balances to represent when the credit card company owes the customer money and positive balances to represent when the customer owes the credit card company money.   Sneha has a balance of $0$ dollars with her credit card company.  **What does a balance of $0$ dollars represent?**

options.content: The credit card company owes Sneha money.
Sneha owes the credit card company money.
Neither Sneha nor the credit card company owes money.

hints.content: Let's visualize the points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  What does each point represent in this context?

images.alt: A number line from negative 5 to 5 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. A solid point labeled question mark is plotted at 0. All spaces left of 0 are labeled Company owes and all spaces right of 0 are labeled Customer owes.

hints.content: $\goldE{0}$ separates when the $\maroonD{\text{credit card company owes}}$ money and when the $\tealE{\text{customer owes}}$ money, so $\goldE{0}$ must represent when neither the credit card company nor customer owes money.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line from negative 5 to 5 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. A solid point labeled Neither owes is plotted at 0. All spaces left of 0 are labeled Company owes and all spaces right of 0 are labeled Customer owes.

hints.content: Sneha's balance of $\goldE{0}$ dollars means neither Sneha nor the credit card company owes money.

question.content: Carl is planning out his route for an upcoming race. He uses negative numbers to represent points before the finish line and positive numbers to represent points past the finish line.  On Carl's map, the last water station is at $-27$ meters, and his family is watching him at $9$ meters.  **What does $0$ meters represent?**

options.content: The last water station
The finish line
Carl's family

hints.content: Let's visualize the points on a number line.  [[☃ image 1]]  What does each point represent in this context?

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 30 to 20 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 5. A solid point labeled Water station is plotted just below negative 25. A solid point labeled question mark is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled Family watching is plotted just below 10.

hints.content: $\blueE{0}$ separates points $\tealE{\text{before}}$ the finish line and points $\maroonD{\text{after}}$ the finish line, so $\blueE{0}$ must represent the finish line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line from negative 30 to 20 with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 5. A solid point labeled Water station is plotted just below negative 25. A solid point labeled Finish line is plotted at 0. A solid point labeled Family watching is plotted just below 10.

hints.content: $\blueE{0}$ represents the finish line.
